data.scheme_name: Indian Footwear Leather and Accessories Development Programme  - Sustainable Technology and Environmental Promotion (STEP)  - North Easthern areas  - Existing
data.benefits: This scheme provides assistance upto 80% for projects in Northeastern areas upto Rs. 20000 lakh.
data.eligibility: <ol><li>The scheme benefits are available to a group of entrepreneurs involved in the leather business who want to set up or improve infrastructure for protecting the environment.
data.conditions:
Appropriate performance guarantee should be built in the agreement to ensure
timely completion of the project

data.nodal_agency: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
data.context: To reduce the environmental problems caused by Leather Industry and tanning activity in particular, this scheme is being created to make industry adopt waste management.
data.objective: This component would provide financial support to Leather Clusters to meet the prescribed pollution control discharge norms. This would cover stablishment / expansion / up gradation of CETPs, developing Secure Land Fills and any other techniques for hazardous waste management.
data.description:
1. The Central Government will fund 80% of project costs (up to Rs 20000 lakhs) for North Eastern areas, with the remaining 20% covered by the industry. 
  2. State Governments can contribute as part of their share. 
  3. Any extra costs due to delays must be covered by the CETP/SPV, and 1% of the government’s assistance will go towards Project Management Consultancy fees.
data.how_to_apply:
To apply for all schemes under the Indian Footwear and Leather Development Programme  - Visit the National Single Window System
To register and apply for financial assistance Log in and click on https://www.nsws.gov.in/ -> “All schemes” -> Select “Indian Footwear and Leather Development Programme” -> Select the applicable sub-scheme"
data.funding_facilitator: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
data.funding_mechanism:
• The SPV must maintain a dedicated Trust and Retention Account (TRA) with a nationalized bank. 
  • Government funds will be deposited into this account and released in four phases: 
  1. First Installment: 25% of the assistance is given as an advance after the project is fully approved, financial closure is achieved, and the SPV deposits its 25% share in the TRA. 
  2. Second Installment: 25% of the assistance is released after using the first installment and the SPV deposits its next 25% share in the TRA. 
  3. Third Installment: 25% of the assistance is released after using the second installment and the SPV deposits its third 25% share in the TRA. 
  4. Fourth Installment: 25% of the assistance is released after using the third installment, and the SPV deposits its final 25% share along with 75% of the State Government's share in the TRA.
data.additional_info:
The unit has to furnish a certificate that they have not availed assistance from any other Ministries/Departments/State Government for the same machinery.

 However, the unit may utilize the machinery purchased under these guidelines for any other industrial production also.
